oai_dc:dc.dc:title: As Red Cross begins drive for 18,000 members, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about the annual Red Cross roll call. The caption reads: “More than 600 women made the census enumerators look like a bunch of pikers as they started the annual Red Cross roll call today. This group, shown at the home of Mrs. W. H. Wemyss, captain, includes, left to right, Mrs. Wemyss, Mrs. Louis Farrell, Jr., Mrs. Gowan Payne, Mrs. Marjorie Sangree, Mrs. Walter Keith, Jr., Mrs. W. L. Meacham, Mrs. Elon Moore, Mrs. Armstrong Allen, Mrs. John Milam, Mrs. Fitzgerald Atkinson and Mrs. W. A. Bass.” Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: American Red Cross
